turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I thought you'd be up with the sun.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: My stupid back.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Do you need anything?  I'll go to the pharmacy.  I have some Demerol at home.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No, I'm...thanks.  I took something.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Where's Sam?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: He won't use my shower.  I don't get it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You brought your kids?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I kind of said that maybe they could do something.  Help.  I'm sorry.  They really wanted to come.  I really wanted to come and they wanted to be with me.  I don't think they'll be too much trouble.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'll find something that won't kill them.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Or wound.  Let them keep their eyes and fingers.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You're a good mother.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Do you need help?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's been a while.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: This was my very first slow dance.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Tell him how you made me fall in love with you.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I smiled at him.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Watch out for the smile, boys.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Let's see if you've gotten any better.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh, I'm worse.  Much, much worse.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Maybe you shouldn't come everyday.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: No.  Why?  I like to be with Sam.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's just that there's less that Adam and Ryan can do anymore.  I'd hate to have them bored.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I know they're not much help, but they love coming here, George.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: How much time do they get to spend with their dad?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What is it with this?  They wouldn't spend less time with Peter if they lived here!  He has no time!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Do you know Alyssa thinks something is up with us?  She's giving me crap about being away from Peter and now you're trying to do the same thing!  What no one seems to realize is that Peter isn't there!  He's not there!  And when he is, he isn't!  So, if you don't want me here, or you don't want my kids here, just tell me, George.  I'll stop coming.  But it won't be because of Peter.  It'll be because you asked me to stop.  Say what you need to say, because I'm not leaving until I hear it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'd rather you not be here.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I thought we were helping.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I can hire workers to help me.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Nothing is going on with us, is it?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Going on?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: When I picked you up from the train station...what you said.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What did I say?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: That thing about I was the most, you know, beautiful person you had ever known.  What was that?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: That was the truth.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: You've never said that before.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'll say a lot of things I've never said before.  It's habit.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: It sounded like a pick-up line.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I can't pick you up.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I'm married.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You bit my finger.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: If I weren't married?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Let's not do this, okay?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I need to know.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You need to know what?  Do I still love you?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Is your back still killing you?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I didn't think you'd come today.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I kept thinking about it, what you said... I hope you were trying to keep me away fro the sake of me.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No.  Mostly me.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Peter left me yesterday.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Left you?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: No goodbye.  No fuck you.  No 'Are you in love with George?'

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What did he say?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: 'I'll be in the bedroom.'

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Back.  Neck.  Back.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I could die.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: So could I.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Are you going to kiss me?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's not my back that's killing me.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Don't move!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm an idiot to have you up there.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I better get the kids home.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Not a perfect day.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Been thinking?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: It'll take you like twenty, thirty minutes.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Does Alyssa know?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You got any weed?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: You got the money?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's your deal with Alyssa?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Don't even...I'm there.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I wasn't sure.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: She wouldn't even fucking go out with until she was sixteen.  I mean, that's not even a rule, just her own thing.  She like figures things out on her own and then that's it.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: He already knows everything about what he can't do.  You can tell him not to even look at you, if you want.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm thinking it's too weird now.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's just a joke.  A stupid joke.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: I could use the money.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: He said he heard hammering.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm sixteen years old.  I'm underage. How could I possibly threaten you?

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: What the fuck?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Everything happens for a reason.  That's what my dad said.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: Then you tell me, what just happened?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: The payoff.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I don't have a clue anymore.  I wish you'd talk to him.  He needs a man.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: His father is a man.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: A man he respects.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: We've eaten.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Is Lois still here?  I'm starved.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I'll make you something.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Do you think it's odd your kids don't hug you?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Should I?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: It would worry me.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: If I let everything that should worry me, worry me, I'd be dead from worry.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What would you be if you asked Adam and Ryan to run in now and hug you?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'd be you.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: To shave your chest?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We should take a vacation.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: The biggest waste of time since television.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Do you remember anything I've said that wasn't negative?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I'd love to drive through New England in the Fall.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Sooner than the Fall.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: After the kids are back in school.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Lois will stay with them.  Or we can pawn them off on your parents.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I'm helping George build his house.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I've been helping for the last few days. Weeks.  Sam's working.  I told you Sam was working.  I mean, he really is.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Good.  That was the plan.  We couldn't stand him and George needed help.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I can't go right now.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You can't go because of Sam?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: We haven't been away together for three years.  What difference does a few months make?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You can't go with me because of Sam?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Sam is working at something for the first time in his life.  Once in a while he even talks to me.  I want to be around for that.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: So am I, Robin.  I'm working at something, too.  I'm even talking.  Do you want to be around for it?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I was talking about our marriage.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: That sounds pathetic, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What are you doing home?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I always felt I could never marry you without first showing you what a fabulous life you cloud live despite me.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: You never really trusted me.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You live a fabulous life, Robin.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Despite you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I never asked for more.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: That's the problem.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Please don't leave me.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Where are the kids?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Sam took them to a movie.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'll be in the bedroom.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I hardly recognize you with a beard.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: That was my plan...to be hardly recognizable to you as me.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I feel in love with George again.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thanks for talking about me behind my back...useful in court.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Are you wearing eye shadow?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Take it off.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Do it now!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: If I walk out the door, who's gonna be here tonight for the follow through?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You don't look like you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Either do you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I thought I might be able to help, but it looks like you have all you can handle.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Do you like red?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You got a dog?

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: It's not ours.  It's George's.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I've missed you guys.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Do you know anything about building a house?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: I guess I could teach you some things.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What are you doing in my room?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I didn't go in your room.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I locked the door!  Get out!  I locked the door!  Get out!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: There were no PG's.  So I just gave them money to play games.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Can you stay for dinner?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Depends on what I'd give up on.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: The door was open.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I don't know what I'm doing.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I wouldn't let Adam or Ryan see you doing it.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: You're sure about this?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: You could keep it and rent it out?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This is what he wants.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I read the letter.  You read the will. He wants you to keep it.  To live in it some day.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Then maybe this isn't what he wants, but this what he was hoping for.  Maybe it's what I want.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Run downstairs and give your dad a hug.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: He'll be gone for his birthday.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Queer.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Dad said it first.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Why do we have to get up and eat with you this early?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I just thought it would be nice.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: All day again?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Not all day.  I'll be home after lunch.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Ryan, would you rather swim or work?

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Can we really help build a house?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I brought a few of my own.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Someone stop her!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Adam, that's not true!

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Yes, it is.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Would you stop being ridiculous?  Your father wants Sam home as much as I do.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Nothing R, okay?

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Enough for drinks, popcorn and candy!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Go tell your father we're eating.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Dad's home, already?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: In the bedroom.

turns.speaker: ABERNATHY
turns.text: They ain't men, Mae Rose. They're convicts. And nigger convicts to boot. Can you say nigger?

turns.speaker: MAE ROSE
turns.text: Nagger?

turns.speaker: ABERNATHY
turns.text: No, nigger.

turns.speaker: MAE ROSE
turns.text: Nigger.

turns.speaker: ABERNATHY
turns.text: That's my girl.

turns.speaker: MAE ROSE
turns.text: A night in the hole?

turns.speaker: ABERNATHY
turns.text: Better make it a week.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: She'll be fine. She just had a bit of a shock.

turns.speaker: ABERNATHY
turns.text: Is Mae Rose okay?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: She's doing just fine.

turns.speaker: ABERNATHY
turns.text: And the baby?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: He's a big one.

turns.speaker: ABERNATHY
turns.text: It's a boy! Well, let's get a look at him.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Biscuit, when you're done with Jangle Leg, you think you could squeeze me in?

turns.speaker: BISCUIT
turns.text: Thought you'd never ask. Biscuit needs some gravy.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm talking about a haircut.

turns.speaker: BISCUIT
turns.text: Cost you a pair of nylons.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Don't take it so hard, Biscuit. She don't mean nothin' to him.

turns.speaker: BISCUIT
turns.text: Hell with him. It ain't that.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: These are free papers.

turns.speaker: BISCUIT
turns.text: What am I gonna do out there, Ray? I can't go home to my mama like this. I'll get the strap for sure.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Come on, Biscuit, this is good news. Your mama's gonna break down in tears when you show up on her doorstep.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It's 1945. It's a different world now.

turns.speaker: BISCUIT
turns.text: Not for me, it ain't.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Well you can't stay here, Biscuit. This ain't no life for a man. Any one of these fellas would give their right arm to be in your shoes. I sure know I would.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: We get the games on the radio sometimes.

turns.speaker: BLOCKER
turns.text: We played down in Jackson yesterday. Heard a rumor you've got a boy up here who can hit the ball a ton.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You probably mean Can't Get Right. That's him over there.

turns.speaker: BLOCKER
turns.text: Can't Get Right? That's the kid's name? Can I talk to him?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You can try, but you won't get too far. Why you interested?

turns.speaker: BLOCKER
turns.text: Crawford's are always looking for new talent.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Maybe you didn't notice, but this is a prison.

turns.speaker: BLOCKER
turns.text: There are ways around that. Right sergeant?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Yo, Blocker, what's going on here?

turns.speaker: BLOCKER
turns.text: Kid's getting out. I got him a pardon.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Yeah, but what about me and Ray? I didn't see our names on that pardon. You said you were gonna put in a good word for us.

turns.speaker: BLOCKER
turns.text: I did, Claude. I mentioned you. I mentioned you both. But the fact is, pardons don't come cheap. The kid can hit. What can you do?

turns.speaker: BLOCKER
turns.text: Look, I am truly sorry about this. I'd like to help you...

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: But you can't.

turns.speaker: BLOCKER
turns.text: At least the kid's getting out. Isn't this what you wanted?

turns.speaker: BOUNCER
turns.text: Oh, no, Ray. Not tonight. Spanky's not happy with you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Is Spanky here?

turns.speaker: BOUNCER
turns.text: No, but...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Then what's the problem?

turns.speaker: BOUNCER
turns.text: Do yourself a favor and find another place where they let you in the front door.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: But this is where the action is and I have to be where the action is. Look, when your old lady wanted those alligator shoes, didn't I come through for you? Ain't she stepping in style now?

turns.speaker: BOUNCER
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Well, alright then. What do you think about this new tie?

turns.speaker: BOUNCER
turns.text: Sharp.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I look good tonight. And I feel lucky, too.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: YVETTE
turns.text: My name's Yvette. Sylvia sent me. You look just like she said.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: She's alright, isn't she?

turns.speaker: YVETTE
turns.text: Oh, she's fine. She's just not coming today.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: YVETTE
turns.text: She got married last month.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Married?

turns.speaker: YVETTE
turns.text: Real nice guy, too. Trumpet player. They moved down to New Orleans.

turns.speaker: YVETTE
turns.text: She always said that if you were on the outside...

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: But I'm not on the outside. I'm in here.

turns.speaker: YVETTE
turns.text: I know she's sorry she won't be seeing you anymore. Anyway, she wanted me to take care of you.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Take care of me?

turns.speaker: YVETTE
turns.text: You know, go to the tonk or whatever.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I'm too old for you. Besides, I'm not much in the mood.

turns.speaker: YVETTE
turns.text: Want me to come back some other time?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Nice girl like you don't belong in a place like this. But if you talk to Sylvia, tell her old Claude said congratulations.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: Damn dentures slipping again. Everything falls apart when you grow old, eh, Claude? Time sure marches on.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Yes, boss.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: You know, I'm fixing on retiring at the end of the summer, gonna try to enjoy what few years I have left. What do you think of this place? It's one of those new retirement communities down on the Gulf.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: I apologize, Claude. That was rude of me.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: That's alright, boss. Takes a lot more than a colorful brochure to hurt my feelings.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: You been on the farm for quite a spell, haven't you?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Over forty years now. Me and Ray Gibson out there.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: Forty years. That's a long time for any crime, even murder.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: It's a hell of a lot longer when you're innocent.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: Half the men in this prison swear they're innocent. Don't you think that's kinda funny?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You have to forgive me if I don't laugh.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: You know I trust you, Claude.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Goodnight, Mr. Wilkins. Mr. Pike.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: Goodnight, Claude.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Cool it, Ray. You're gonna get us in a lot of trouble.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: He's right, Gibson. Put down the gun and we'll work this out.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: Claude, mind helping me to the bathroom?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Sure, boss.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: I'm not your boss. Not anymore.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I got it... boss.

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: He don't sound like he's from 'round here.

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: I don't see no wedding ring, Banks. Conjugal visits are for married prisoners only.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You think you could make an exception just this once, boss? She came all the way down from New York.

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: I don't need the Baptists on my back, but I suppose I could issue a temporary marriage license for a nominal fee.

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: Craddock!... Williams... Henshaw!... Banks!

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Here!

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: Comfortable?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: As a pair of fur-lined bedroom slippers, boss.

turns.speaker: DILLARD
turns.text: We'll see what those slippers feel like after, say, 24 hours. And if you step down off them bottles -- if one toe so much as touches the dirt -- one of these boys is gonna shoot you dead. Let's see. We need a special man for this job.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: For the kind of money they charge here, you'd think they could hire somebody to actually wash the dishes.

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: Claude. Here's to your new job down at the bank. I always knew you'd make something of yourself.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Know what I'm going to buy with my first pay check?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Season tickets to the Yankees. Right there on the first base line.  What's wrong, baby?

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: I was hoping you were gonna say an engagement ring, Claude.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Engagement ring!

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: That's what respectable folks do. Get a job, get married, start having babies. That's what you want, isn't it?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Sure it is. I just don't see any reason to rush into things. Damn, look at this shirt. I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Come on, honey, let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: But I'm having a good time...

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Did you go see my cousin Maynard like I asked you in my letter?

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: Of course I did. He said he'd file an appeal right away. You didn't tell me he was so good looking.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Yeah, that side of the family has all the looks and none of the brains. I hope he don't mess things up.

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: He seemed like a pretty good lawyer to me. His offices take up an entire floor of that big, new building on 125th Street, and he was using all these words I never heard before. He even offered me a job.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: A job, huh? Well, that's nice, real nice. You won't have to work long. I'll be back soon enough. After I start work at First Federal Bank of Manhattan, I'll be keeping you in style. Everything will get back to normal again. That's a promise.

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: Listen, Claude, Maynard wanted to know if he should file the appeal on behalf of your friend, too.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Ray Gibson?  No, no. He's the reason I'm in here, Daisy. For all I know, he's got a record a mile long. I got a better shot of getting out of here on my own. You tell Maynard to think about me, concentrate on me. Understand?

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: Sure, Claude, whatever you say.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I've never seen you in here before.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: That's because I've never been here before.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I'm Sylvia. What's your name?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Can't you remember your own name?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I know it begins with a "C"...

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Well, Mr. "C", how about buying a girl a drink?  Two bourbons.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I really shouldn't. I gotta keep an eye on my friend.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: He looks like he can take care of himself.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Claude. That's my name. Claude. That's never happened before.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: You're cute. You have any money, Claude?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Ten dollars. But I need it to get home.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Why would you want to go home? It's so early.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Don't I know you?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Sure I do. What's your name again?

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Claude Banks.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Claude Banks. How could I forget that? You've got to remember me. Ray Gibson. We went to high school together.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: You went to Monroe?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's right! Good old Monroe...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Here, this belongs to you.  It was empty when I found it.

turns.speaker: CLAUDE
turns.text: Good old Monroe.
